TASK-28: Domain Events

Overview

Implement domain event emission for key business actions to enable audit logging, analytics, notifications, and future integrations.

Event Architecture

Event Structure

interface DomainEvent {
  event_type: string;           // e.g., "path_preference_set"
  event_timestamp: string;      // ISO 8601 timestamp
  user_id: string;              // Actor who triggered the event
  user_email: string;           // Actor's email
  entity_type: string;          // e.g., "user_path_preference"
  entity_id: string;            // ID of the affected entity
  metadata: Record<string, any>; // Event-specific data
  correlation_id?: string;      // For tracking related events
}

Storage Options

  1. Database Table (Recommended for MVP)
    • Create domain_events table
    • Simple, queryable, transactional
    • Good for audit trail and analytics
  2. Message Queue (Future Enhancement)
    • Kafka, RabbitMQ, or AWS SQS
    • Better for real-time processing
    • Enables event-driven architecture
  3. Hybrid Approach
    • Store in DB for audit
    • Publish to queue for real-time processing

Events to Implement

1. path_preference_set

Trigger: User expresses interest in a career path
Location: When user clicks “I’m Interested” on career path card
Metadata:

{
  "path_id": "uuid",
  "path_name": "Full Stack Developer",
  "interest_level": "high",
  "source": "career_paths_tab"
}

2. project_invited

Trigger: Leader invites user to project
Location: POST /api/invitations endpoint
Metadata:

{
  "project_id": "uuid",
  "project_title": "Project Alpha",
  "invited_user_id": "uuid",
  "invited_user_email": "user@example.com",
  "invited_by_id": "uuid",
  "invited_by_email": "leader@example.com",
  "role": "Backend Developer"
}

3. invite_accepted

Trigger: User accepts project invitation
Location: PUT /api/invitations/:id/accept endpoint
Metadata:

{
  "invitation_id": "uuid",
  "project_id": "uuid",
  "project_title": "Project Alpha",
  "user_id": "uuid",
  "user_email": "user@example.com",
  "accepted_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z"
}

4. learning_added

Trigger: User adds completed learning entry
Location: POST /api/learning endpoint
Metadata:

{
  "learning_id": "uuid",
  "title": "Python for Beginners",
  "issuer": "IBM",
  "type": "course",
  "completion_date": "2024-01-10",
  "related_skills": ["Python", "Programming"],
  "evidence_url": "https://..."
}

5. learning_verified

Trigger: Leader verifies learning entry
Location: PUT /api/learning/:id/verify endpoint
Metadata:

{
  "learning_id": "uuid",
  "learning_title": "Python for Beginners",
  "user_id": "uuid",
  "user_email": "user@example.com",
  "verified_by_id": "uuid",
  "verified_by_email": "leader@example.com",
  "verification_notes": "Certificate verified"
}

6. fit_scored

Trigger: Matching algorithm calculates fit score
Location: POST /api/match/role endpoint
Metadata:

{
  "candidate_id": "uuid",
  "candidate_email": "user@example.com",
  "project_id": "uuid",
  "fit_score": 85,
  "missing_skills": ["Docker", "Kubernetes"],
  "level_shortfalls": [{"skill": "Python", "gap": 1}],
  "meets_must_haves": true,
  "suggested_learning_count": 3
}

Implementation

Database Migration

-- Create domain_events table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS domain_events (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    event_type TEXT NOT NULL,
    event_timestamp TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    user_email TEXT NOT NULL,
    entity_type TEXT NOT NULL,
    entity_id TEXT NOT NULL,
    metadata JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '{}',
    correlation_id UUID,
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Indexes for common queries
CREATE INDEX idx_domain_events_type ON domain_events(event_type);
CREATE INDEX idx_domain_events_user ON domain_events(user_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_domain_events_entity ON domain_events(entity_type, entity_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_domain_events_timestamp ON domain_events(event_timestamp DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_domain_events_correlation ON domain_events(correlation_id) WHERE correlation_id IS NOT NULL;

-- Enable Row Level Security
ALTER TABLE domain_events ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Policy: Leaders/managers can read all events
CREATE POLICY domain_events_read_admin ON domain_events
    FOR SELECT
    USING (
        EXISTS (
            SELECT 1 FROM users
            WHERE users.id = auth.uid()
            AND users.access_role IN ('leader', 'manager')
        )
    );

-- Policy: Users can read their own events
CREATE POLICY domain_events_read_own ON domain_events
    FOR SELECT
    USING (user_id = auth.uid());

Event Emitter Helper (server.js)

/**
 * Emit a domain event to the database
 * @param {Object} event - Event details
 * @param {string} event.type - Event type (e.g., 'path_preference_set')
 * @param {string} event.userId - User ID who triggered the event
 * @param {string} event.userEmail - User email
 * @param {string} event.entityType - Type of entity affected
 * @param {string} event.entityId - ID of affected entity
 * @param {Object} event.metadata - Additional event data
 * @param {string} [event.correlationId] - Optional correlation ID
 */
async function emitDomainEvent({ type, userId, userEmail, entityType, entityId, metadata = {}, correlationId = null }) {
    try {
        const { error } = await supabase
            .from('domain_events')
            .insert({
                event_type: type,
                event_timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
                user_id: userId,
                user_email: userEmail,
                entity_type: entityType,
                entity_id: entityId,
                metadata,
                correlation_id: correlationId
            });
        
        if (error) {
            console.error(`[EVENT] Failed to emit ${type}:`, error.message);
        } else {
            console.log(`[EVENT] Emitted: ${type} for ${entityType}:${entityId}`);
        }
    } catch (e) {
        console.error(`[EVENT] Error emitting ${type}:`, e.message);
    }
}

Integration Points

1. Path Preference Set

File: server.js - Career path preference endpoint
Location: POST /api/path-preferences (needs to be created)

app.post("/api/path-preferences", requireProxyIdentity, async (req, res) => {
    try {
        const me = await getOrCreateUserByEmail(req.__email);
        const { path_id, interest_level } = req.body;
        
        // Insert preference
        const { data, error } = await supabase
            .from("user_path_preferences")
            .insert({ user_id: me.id, path_id, interest_level })
            .select("*, career_paths(name)")
            .single();
        
        if (error) throw error;
        
        // Emit event
        await emitDomainEvent({
            type: 'path_preference_set',
            userId: me.id,
            userEmail: me.email,
            entityType: 'user_path_preference',
            entityId: data.id,
            metadata: {
                path_id,
                path_name: data.career_paths?.name,
                interest_level,
                source: 'career_paths_tab'
            }
        });
        
        res.json({ preference: data });
    } catch (e) {
        res.status(500).json({ error: e.message });
    }
});

2. Project Invited

File: server.js - Invitation creation endpoint
Location: POST /api/invitations (needs to be created)

// After successful invitation creation
await emitDomainEvent({
    type: 'project_invited',
    userId: me.id,
    userEmail: me.email,
    entityType: 'project_invitation',
    entityId: invitation.id,
    metadata: {
        project_id: invitation.project_id,
        project_title: project.title,
        invited_user_id: invitation.user_id,
        invited_user_email: invitedUser.email,
        invited_by_id: me.id,
        invited_by_email: me.email,
        role: invitation.role
    }
});

// After successful acceptance
await emitDomainEvent({
    type: 'invite_accepted',
    userId: me.id,
    userEmail: me.email,
    entityType: 'project_invitation',
    entityId: invitation.id,
    metadata: {
        invitation_id: invitation.id,

        project_title: project.title,

        accepted_at: new Date().toISOString()

});

4. Learning Added

Location: POST /api/learning (needs to be created)

// After successful learning entry creation
await emitDomainEvent({
    type: 'learning_added',
    userId: me.id,
    userEmail: me.email,
    entityType: 'user_learning',
    entityId: learning.id,
    metadata: {
        learning_id: learning.id,
        title: learning.title,
        issuer: learning.issuer,
        type: learning.type,
        completion_date: learning.completion_date,
        related_skills: learning.related_skills || [],

});

File: server.js - Line 1169 (existing endpoint)
Add after line 1206:

// Emit event
await emitDomainEvent({
    type: 'learning_verified',
    userId: me.id,
    userEmail: me.email,
    entityType: 'user_learning',
    entityId: id,
    metadata: {
        learning_id: id,
        learning_title: entry.title,
        user_id: entry.user_id,
        verified_by_id: me.id,
        verified_by_email: me.email,
        verification_notes: verification_notes
    }
});

6. Fit Scored

File: server.js - Line 469 (existing endpoint)
Add after line 630 (before sorting):

// Emit events for each candidate scored
for (const result of results) {
    await emitDomainEvent({
        type: 'fit_scored',
        userId: me.id,
        userEmail: me.email,
        entityType: 'match_result',
        entityId: result.candidateId,
        metadata: {
            candidate_id: result.candidateId,
            candidate_email: result.candidateEmail,
            project_id: projectId || null,
            fit_score: result.fitScore,
            missing_skills: result.missing,
            level_shortfalls: result.levelShortfalls,
            meets_must_haves: result.meetsMustHaves,
            suggested_learning_count: result.suggestedLearning.length
        }
    });
}

Analytics & Reporting

Event Queries

-- Most active users (by event count)
SELECT user_email, COUNT(*) as event_count
FROM domain_events
WHERE event_timestamp > NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
GROUP BY user_email
ORDER BY event_count DESC
LIMIT 10;

-- Popular career paths
SELECT 
    metadata->>'path_name' as path_name,
    COUNT(*) as interest_count
FROM domain_events
WHERE event_type = 'path_preference_set'
GROUP BY metadata->>'path_name'
ORDER BY interest_count DESC;

-- Invitation acceptance rate
SELECT 
    COUNT(CASE WHEN event_type = 'project_invited' THEN 1 END) as invited,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN event_type = 'invite_accepted' THEN 1 END) as accepted,
    ROUND(
        100.0 * COUNT(CASE WHEN event_type = 'invite_accepted' THEN 1 END) / 
        NULLIF(COUNT(CASE WHEN event_type = 'project_invited' THEN 1 END), 0),
        2
    ) as acceptance_rate_pct
FROM domain_events
WHERE event_timestamp > NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days';

-- Learning verification lag
SELECT 
    AVG(
        EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (
            (SELECT event_timestamp FROM domain_events ve 
             WHERE ve.event_type = 'learning_verified' 
             AND ve.metadata->>'learning_id' = ae.metadata->>'learning_id'
             LIMIT 1)
            - ae.event_timestamp
        )) / 86400
    ) as avg_days_to_verify
FROM domain_events ae
WHERE ae.event_type = 'learning_added'
AND ae.event_timestamp > NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days';

Future Enhancements

1. Real-time Notifications

  • Subscribe to events via WebSocket
  • Push notifications to users
  • Email notifications for key events

2. Event Replay

  • Rebuild state from events
  • Audit trail reconstruction
  • Time-travel debugging

3. Event-Driven Workflows

  • Trigger automated actions
  • Integration with external systems
  • Workflow orchestration

4. Analytics Dashboard

  • Real-time event metrics
  • User engagement tracking
  • Conversion funnel analysis

Implementation Status

Notes

  • Events are fire-and-forget (don’t block main operations)
  • Failed event emissions are logged but don’t fail the request
  • Consider batching events for high-volume operations
  • Use correlation IDs to track related events
  • Implement event retention policy (e.g., keep 90 days)
